field.name: prevalence
field.description: allows to give more or less weight to observations of a particular class
field.title: weighted response weights

field.name: var_import
field.description: number of permutations to estimate the relative importance of each variable
field.title: resampling

field.name: do_full_models
field.description: calibrate & evaluate models with the whole dataset?
field.title: do full models

field.name: do.classif
field.description: true for a classification, false for a regression forest. Currently ignored in biomod2 source
field.title: do.classif

field.name: ntree
field.description: Number of trees to grow. This should not be set to too small a number, to ensure that every input row gets sampled at least a few times.
field.title: number of trees

field.name: mtry
field.description: Number of variables randomly sampled as candidates at each split. Default is 'sqrt(p)' for classification trees, where p is the number of variables.
field.title: number of variables at each split (mtry)

field.name: nodesize
field.description: Minimum size of terminal nodes. Setting this number larger causes smaller trees to be grown (and thus take less time), however for best accuracy use nodesize = 1.
field.title: node size

field.name: maxnodes
field.description: Maximum number of terminal nodes trees that the forest can have. If not given, trees are grown to the maximum possible (subject to limits by node size).
field.title: maximum nodes
